column4: please can someone check why apt-get is failing? http://rafb.net/p/QOEqHT65.html
the us mirror no longer has gutsy packages becouse gutsy is discontinued as already have been pointed out to you
if you got to initramfs the something happened. do you get any error message?
like, no root found,. or give up waiting for root or something like that ( no init found )
im on a laptop and had some energy problems and then got the initramfs
sometimes doing "exit" in the initramfs can continue the boot process but usually there is some underlying issue
the last msg that it gives me is: attached SCSI removable disk
i typed exit but nothing happened, it just hold there
then something else is wrong. reboot and look for the error that drops you to the initramfs
it is too fast, cant read what is the problem, how can i read it?
i would edit grub menu to remove splash and quiet from kernel line
just typed exit and got the following: cant open /root/dev/console : no such file
how would i do that?
with a live cd?
when booting in the grub menu press "e" to edit the menu entry
remove splash and quiet from the kernel line and do "ctl +x " to boot the modified entry?
now..?
crtl + x to boot the modified entry
just did it and again i land in the same place
you should be able to see more info
yes, but it gets too fast and get to the same point
i did what you said, but still get the same in initramfs
